body:
> [@AndriySvyryd](https://github.com/AndriySvyryd) this looks like PR [#20012](https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/pull/20012).

If you mean that the error was introduced in that PR, yes you are right.
I am also having the same issue in Azure 100% of the time.  Works locally.  Does not work remotely.

This sounds like the same issue I've been struggling with for some months, without having any idea of the root cause. From time to time the NServiceBus transactions throws `System.InvalidOperationException: A root ambient transaction was completed before the nested transaction. The nested transactions should be completed first.`, but the database transaction is completed and committed, so the NServiceBus retry handling can't recover as the database changes are not rolled back.

I'm wondering if someone might have some tips to workaround our specific usecase, but maybe asking Particular would be better.

We use NServiceBus with SqlServerTransport. The message receive/sending is done inside a TransactionScope (SendsAtomicWithReceive), which is the outer/root TransactionScope in this scenario. Then we use NServiceBus' "Unit of Work" with handlers wrapped in a TransactionScope, which becomes the inner/nested scope in this scenario.
Our issue is that this nested scope has completed and committed to the database, but then the NServiceBus messages are not sent due to the `System.InvalidOperationException: A root ambient transaction was completed before the nested transaction. The nested transactions should be completed first.` error. NServiceBus automatically retries the message correctly, but since the DB transaction was completed, the message is discarded as a duplicate.
I'm not sure how to work around this, if it is even possible. Right now we just have to manually fix every case we encounter, typically a few cases every day.

issue.title: [rc2] Fix concurrency issue in RelationalConnection ambient transaction handling

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Fixes #35856

**Description**
There was a race condition between `ClearTransactions` and `HandleTransactionCompleted` methods in `RelationalConnection` that could cause exceptions in distributed transaction scenarios accessing `_ambientTransactions` from different threads.

**Customer impact**
The issue affects applications using distributed transactions with MSDTC. Customers experience random application failures with no clear workaround other than avoiding distributed transactions.

**How found**
Customer reported on EF8.

**Regression**
Yes, from EF Core 3.1. Introduced in dotnet/efcore#20012

**Testing**
Test added

**Risk**
Low. Changes are focused on improving thread safety of existing ambient transaction functionality. The synchronization is only applied when ambient transactions are used, minimizing performance impact on regular database operations.

issue.title: Test `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.RelationalConnectionTest.HandleTransactionCompleted_with_concurrent_ClearTransactions_is_thread_safe` is flaky

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
```text
Assert.Empty() Failure: Collection was not empty
Collection: [System.ObjectDisposedException: Cannot access a disposed object.
Object name: 'System.Transactions.TransactionScope'.
   at System.Transactions.TransactionScope.Complete()
   at Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.RelationalConnectionTest.<>c__DisplayClass46_1.<<HandleTransactionCompleted_with_concurrent_ClearTransactions_is_thread_safe>b__1>d.MoveNext() in /_/test/EFCore.Relational.Tests/RelationalConnectionTest.cs:line 1138]
```
